abstract: Belgian government reports that 350 Belgians traveled to Syria to join extremist groups and more than 70 of them have returned home, posing severe risk to national security.
lead_paragraph: The recent thwarting of a terrorist operation highlights the dangers posed by a well-developed underground pipeline that has made Belgium the biggest per capita contributor in Europe of fighters to Syria.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

snippet: The recent thwarting of a terrorist operation highlights the dangers posed by a well-developed underground pipeline that has made Belgium the biggest per capita contributor in Europe of fighters to Syria.

headline.main: Belgium Confronts the Jihadist Danger Within
headline.print_headline: Belgium Confronts the Jihadist Danger Within
